description:
The tool is designed to read, process, analyze, and report on data produced by phasor measurement units (PMUs). It has
three main functions:
Data ingestion and processing
Forced oscillation detection
Event tracking
Result writing
Ambient oscillation baselining
Spectral analysis and event detection
Dominant mode identification
Result writing
Data ingestion involves reading PMU data from CSV files, concatenating it, and applying standard signal processing
techniques to prepare the data for analysis.
The forced oscillation detection portion of the tool examines the data for evidence of a particular dynamic phenomenon in
power systems known as forced oscillations. It is implemented with a periodogram-based method that was developed at
PNNL. Forced oscillation events are tracked across time. Results are written to CSV files.
The ambient oscillation baselining portion of the tool is based on the Robust Modified Daniell-Welch (RMDW) spectral
estimator, which was developed at PNNL. It produces estimates of the signal's ambient spectrum while detecting large
power system events. The ambient spectrum is analyzed to identify the most observable (dominant) mode frequency. At
the end of each day, the tool applies the k-means clustering algorithm to distinguish between dominant system modes.
Results are written to CSV files.
name: Eastern Interconnection Situational Awareness Monitoring System (ESAMS) Oscillation Tool

permissions.exemptionText: This source code is restricted by patent and / or intellectual property law.
